sentence.Network_en: Spectacular changes have taken place at the top since the failed putsch.
sentence.Network_cn: 政变失败后，高层出现了急剧的变化。

sentence.Network_en: Among the most spectacular sights are the great sea-bird colonies.
sentence.Network_cn: 庞大的海鸟群是最壮观的景象之一。

sentence.Network_en: I called Andie to tell her how spectacular the stuff looked.
sentence.Network_cn: 我打电话告诉安迪，那东西看上去太棒了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from spectacle, on the pattern of words such as oracular

entry.tran: 引人注目的;惊人的;壮观的
entry.def: Something that is spectacular is very impressive or dramatic.

example.ex: ...spectacular views of the Sugar Loaf Mountain...
They have revamped the business with spectacular success...
example.tran: 他们成功地调整了业务，成绩斐然。

entry.tran: 壮观的表演;盛大的演出
entry.def: A spectacular is a show or performance which is very grand and impressive.

example.ex: ...one of the world's great sporting spectaculars.
example.tran: 世界上最壮观的体育盛事之一

means.word_mean: 1. sensational in appearance or thrilling in effect;

sentences.sentence: "his striking good looks always created a sensation"

means.word_mean: 2. of the nature of spectacle or drama;
3. having a quality that thrusts itself into attention;

sentences.sentence: "an outstanding fact of our time is that nations poisoned by anti semitism proved less fortunate in regard to their own freedom"
"a new theory is the most prominent feature of the book"
"a striking thing about Picadilly Circus is the statue of Eros in the center"
"a striking resemblance between parent and child"

auth_sentence.content: I've often seen them and it is spectacular!
auth_sentence.res_content: I've often seen them and it is spectacular!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I've often seen them and it is spectacular!

auth_sentence.content: Vernon Davis's two spectacular touchdowns ultimately proved insufficient.
auth_sentence.res_content: Vernon Davis's two spectacular touchdowns ultimately proved insufficient.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Vernon Davis's two spectacular touchdowns ultimately proved insufficient.

auth_sentence.content: In newly diabetic mice, the results were spectacular.
auth_sentence.res_content: In newly diabetic mice, the results were spectacular.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In newly diabetic mice, the results were spectacular.

stems_affixes.word_buile: circum周围+spect看→看周围→小心
per全部+spect看+ive……的→看透了的→透视的
prospect前景+ive……的→adj.预期的
respect尊敬+able可以……的→adj.可敬的;人格高尚的
respect尊敬,尊重+ful有……的→adj.恭敬的,尊重的
re回+spect看+ive……的→回头看[自己]→各自的
retrospect[v.回顾,回想]+ive……的→adj.追想的,回顾的
spect看+acular……的→adj.壮观的,引人注目的 n.壮观的演出
respective[adj.各自的,各个的]+ly表副词→adv.分别地, 各个地
pro前面+spect看→向前看→前景

stems_affixes.value_cn: 样子, 外表, 面貌, [问题等的]方面
stems_affixes.word_buile: a加强意义+spect看→看的东西→外表,容貌
circumspect[adj.小心谨慎的]+ion表名词→n.细心,慎重
inspect[v.检查,调查,视察]+or人→n.检查员, 巡视员
inspect[v.检查,调查,视察]+ion表名词→n.检查,审查;检阅

stems_affixes.value_cn: 章程,内容简介;创办计划
stems_affixes.word_buile: pro前+spect看+us→向前看的东西
re再+spect看→再看[一眼]→尊敬
spect看+acle东西→看的东西→景象;眼镜
spect看+acular……的→adj.壮观的,引人注目的 n.壮观的演出
spect看+ator人→看的人
spect看+rum→可以看的范围
re再+spect看→再看[一眼]→尊敬
ex出+pect=spect看→看出去,看外面→期待
in内,里面+spect看→看里面→检查
retro向后+spect看→向后看
spec=spect看+ulate→看准了→思考,投机
sus下面+spect看→在下面看一看,斜眼看→怀疑

Sentence.sentence: Those factors are more than enough to make up for the squalor (肮脏), disease and spectacular poverty that those same migrants must often at first endure when they become urban dwellers.
With creativity, even old-fashioned instruments may produce spectacular sound effects.

means.word_mean: 壮观的, 雄伟的, 引人入胜的

sentences.cn: 这是一部场面壮观的电影。

sentences.en: The ceremonial opening of the exhibition was very spectacular.
sentences.cn: 展览会的开幕式非常壮观。

jushi.english: The discovery of atom was a spectacular achievement in science.
jushi.chinese: 原子的发现是科学上一项惊人的成就。
这是一部场面壮观的电影。

jushi.english: The ceremonial opening of the exhibition was very spectacular.
jushi.chinese: 展览会的开幕式非常壮观。
